definition: hatred/animosity/enmity/foe/enemy/to feel animosity toward (the wealthy, foreigners etc)

sentences.english: She faces charges of inciting racial hatred by distributing anti-semitic leaflets.
sentences.chinese: 她因散发反犹传单而面临着煽动种族仇恨的指控。

sentences.english: Those early years' folding Ru old grudge have already eliminated thin?
sentences.chinese: 难道当年的折辱仇恨已经消淡了？

sentences.english: Weeks regardless of the environment is good or bad, always with a heart of hatred.
sentences.chinese: 无论周里环境是好是歹，总是怀着一颗仇恨的心。

sentences.english: My hatred burns through the cavernous deeps.
sentences.chinese: 人的仇恨正在淡渊的尽尾熊熊燃焚。

sentences.english: For him and for her own, she's willing to keep the hatred burning and never goes out.
sentences.chinese: 为他也为自己，她愿成为让仇恨之火燃烧更烈的柴薪。

sentences.english: The faces of these idols were distorted and grotesque with violent expressions of anger and hatred.
sentences.chinese: 这些偶像各个面目狰狞，满是仇恨和愤怒。

sentences.english: The hatred between these two families never quite flickered out.
sentences.chinese: 这两家人之间的仇恨从来没真正消除。
他的眼睛里露出仇恨的目光。

sentences.english: It's been a big source of stress and self-hate.
sentences.chinese: 这是压力和自我仇恨的巨大来源。

sentences.english: The invasion has ignited the hatred of the people.
sentences.chinese: 入侵已激起了人民的仇恨。

sentences.english: A century's enmity and countless deaths stand between us and the Hun.
sentences.chinese: 一个世纪的仇恨，无数的死亡横在我们及破坏者之间。

sentences.english: Theyhate the liberating breeze of democracy.
sentences.chinese: 他们仇恨摧枯拉朽的民主春风。

sentences.english: The gredinedst source of misery and hwithred in this world is clinging to past hurts.
sentences.chinese: 这个世界上难堪与仇恨最大源泉是对畴前的执迷。

sentences.english: Hate is a dead thing. Who of you would be a tomb?
sentences.chinese: 仇恨是让人窒息的，试想你们有谁愿作那坟墓？

sentences.english: It was a bitter, vindictive campaign for the most part.
sentences.chinese: 选举过程中大部份是苦毒与仇恨。

sentences.english: Release your hatred. Forgive those who trespassed against you.
sentences.chinese: 放弃仇恨，宽恕那些冒犯你的人。

definition: to resent/to harbor a grudge against/to loathe/resentment/rancor
to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
hostile/malevolence/antagonism/to view as enemy/to stand against
to loathe/to hate/to abhor/see also 憎惡|憎恶[zeng1 e4]
to hate evil/see also 憎惡|憎恶[zeng1 wu4]
to hate out of jealousy/to resent
